    Compute One-shot opportunistic companies over the crisiss indicator

    ind_7.Rd

    The indicator focuses on companies that after the emergency outbreak were awarded one or more public contracts having participated in the public procurement process without winning in the 5 years before the emergency outbreak

    Motivation:

    The red flag considers at risk those companies that show a "one- shot opportunistic behaviour", that is, companies that after the emergency outbreak were awarded one or more public contracts but did not show any competitive power in the previous years

    Scoring Rule

    If a company wins one or more contracts after the emergency outbreak having participated in the public procurement process without winning in the 5 years before the emergency outbreak -> 1, otherwise 0

    Main target unit

    This indicator targets companies

    Usage

    ind_7(data, publication_date, final_award_date, emergency_name, stat_unit)

    Arguments

    data

    mock_data_core exmaple data

    publication_date

    The date when the tender was published

    final_award_date

    Date of award, as per the minutes

    emergency_name

    emergency name character string for which you want to evaluate the indicator, e.g. "Coronavirus" "Terremoto Aquila"

    stat_unit

    The unique ID Code that identifies the awarded company (ex. VAT or Tax Number)

    Value

    indicator schema as from generate_indicator_schema

    See also

    ymd, interval, period nest mutate, across, reexports, if_else, group_by as_factor

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
if (interactive()) {
  data("mock_data_core")
  ind_7(
    data = mock_data_core,
    publication_date = data_pubblicazione,
    final_award_date = data_aggiudicazione_definitiva,
    stat_unit = cf_amministrazione_appaltante,
    emergency_name = "coronavirus"
  )
}
}
